hackathon-description-text: SLO Hacks is a 200-student, 24-hour hackathon hosted at Cal Poly SLO on February 3-4. Get ready for the largest hackathon in central California and a weekend full of building and learning!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Cal Poly Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship
Chairman of the Cal Poly CSSE Industrial Advisory Board

hackathon-eligibility: College students, or high schoolers over the age of 18.
hackathon-rules:
Please refer to the
Teams are limited to 4 PEOPLE MAX.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Nintendo Switches, Fire TV sticks, and iFixit kits for each member of the winning team
Anker speakers, Tile Mates, and iFixit kits for each member of the winning team
Google Home Minis for each member of the winning team
Google Home Mini and a Chromecast for each member of the winning team, sponsored by Google Cloud Platform
$100 Amazon gift card for each member of the team, sponsored by GoDaddy

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi Kit for each member of the winning team
$250 Amazon gift card for each member of the winning team
$40 Amazon gift card for each member of the winning team, sponsored by HackHive
Destek VR Headset for each member of the winning team, sponsored by Twilio
Prompt: Solve a problem for a college student to help become more financially prosperous.
Unity Pro License for each member of the winning team

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=113 Longview Ln, San Luis Obispo, CA 93405, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?

hackathon-location-address: 113 Longview Ln, San Luis Obispo, CA 93405, USA
hackathon-description-header: 24-hour, 200-student collegiate hackathon in San Luis Obispo
